 I have actually heard him before - I thought he was big fun (and cute to boot!)
 
 I have never understood the music genre wars. I was trying to play Beethoven on my bass the other day. I wonder how many metal heads realize they have a musical sibling in classical? The same complicated melodies and dramatic sound. And how many punks know that they simply listening to early country/rock juiced up fast? Style influences style and falls back on itself. I can listen to Dwight Yokem, Mozart, Adrew Lloyd Webber, Nirvana, Zeppelin and Snoop Dogg all in the same day!
 
 Music is the most perfect human creation - besides other humans. (yes, this is my bias). :)

 I agree with you there, I figure if I like the music who cares what genre the music is? And it's funny how they remake old songs and put a little more beat into it and speed it up. My little brother was astonished when my mom started singing along to "What a Wonderful World" remade on a movie soundtrack (forget which one) and "I'm a Believer" from Shrek. He really thought "I'm a believer was written just for the movie. I also heard that he country song "Beautiful Mess" by Diamond Rio was supposed to be recorded by someone else. The someone else? Eminem.

 Lots of R&B ballads were originally country ballads "I can love you like that/make you my girl..." was originally John Michael Montgomery - and there are others. Sometimes they will go the other way - Joss Stone's sultry ballad "Fell in Love With a Boy" was originally a perky little number by the White Stripes.
 
 Funny story on the new generation - my 12 year neice came up to me and my sister in law a few weeks ago to tell us all about this great new band called Green Day. :p

Funny you mention punk--when I was younger I was into the punk scene, which led me to the ska scene, both of which eventually led me back into the early 80s/late 70s punk/ska scene in the UK, and a lot of the ska eventually led me to being interested in older rock (50s and 60s) as well as jazz. Within two years I went from Dead Kennedys to Benny Goodman. Who knew? :p 
 
 My playlist now looks like it belongs to 3 different people. Dead Kennedys next to Dvorak, Rachmaninoff next to Rage Against the Machine, Glenn Miller next to Green Day and CCR next to The Clash.
I like that 'train' song, pretty good. And it's not like the background music is someone else's (like all that rap sampling) - they have a real band in the back.
